instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00045 dont detect ssd
threads.message: Hello, i have a1534 2015, problem is that it dont detect hdd at all. has anybody faced that problem?

threads.title: 820-00045 dont detect ssd
threads.message: Yup, pretty common fault on these...would be a bitch to fix. If it was liquid, hopes are a bit higher. If it was random or a drop, this will be a nightmare.

threads.title: 820-00045 dont detect ssd
threads.message:
i heard that reballing hhd's doesnt help. maybe controller reball would help, but its Package on Package over 1000 solder balls.

has anybody did that fault?

threads.title: 820-00045 dont detect ssd
threads.message:
No good news about this yet.
I don't know if someone tried to reflash SSD ROM.
Medusa guy sells now a new board adapter for various chips (A4069).
That will fit SSD ROM for A1534 and probably USB-C ROM too.

threads.title: 820-00045 dont detect ssd
threads.message: noticed if a bit force the housing of mb, it detects ssd. so means somewhere is cold joint. which ic does control ssd's?

threads.title: 820-00045 dont detect ssd
threads.message:
Sounds broken solder under some BGA chip from SSD area.
Could be the controller, NAND, ROM, or even missing voltage.
It is hopeless project.

You can try your luck with the chips from pages 54-59, or put entire board into IR oven...
